stanza.line: Sin of self love possesseth all mine eye
And all my soul and all my everypart
And for this sin there is no remedy
It is so grounded inward in myheart
Methinks no face so gracious is asmine
No shape so true no truth of suchaccount
And for my self mine own worth dodefine
As I all other in all worthssurmount
But when my glass shows me my self indeed
beated and chopt with tanned antiquity
Mine own self love quite contrary I read
Self so self loving were iniquity
Tis thee my self that for my self I praise Painting my age with beauty of thy days
